title: Zelensky Says ‘No One Knows’ When War in Ukraine Will End
description: Zelensky said he had turned down a request from the military — for now — to mobilize as many as 500,000 Ukrainians for the army.

title: Poland Finds 14 Foreigners Guilty of Spying for Russia
description: The defendants, who received jail terms ranging from 13 months to six years, were convicted in absentia after they all pleaded guilty and skipped the trial.

title: Ex-Chechen Rebel Arrested in Russia After 24 Years
description: Law enforcement authorities accused the man of being involved in a September 1999 attack that killed 99 people and wounded 238 others.

title: Wikimedia Russia Shuts Down Amid 'Foreign Agent' Threats
description: Russia’s communications regulator has accused Wikipedia of allowing the spread of “false” and “unreliable” information about the war in Ukraine.

title: Russian Wartime Emigres Head Westward in Europe in Search of Acceptance, Tolerance
description: After initially landing in eastern Europe, Turkey or the Caucasus, some Russians are looking to settle down further west.

title: Russian Deserter Taken to Russia After Detention in Armenia – Activists
description: Dmitry Setrakov has reportedly been moved to Rostov-on-Don after being held at a Russian military base in the Armenian city of Gyumri.

title: Russian Defense Minister Says 4K Students ‘Volunteered’ to Fight in Ukraine
description: Sergei Shoigu also praised university students for making camouflage nets and donating blood for soldiers on the front line.

title: Putin Says Russian Society Unified in Support of Ukraine War
description: "Maybe this is the most important thing — the general consolidation of all forces within society," the Russian leader said Tuesday.

title: Russia’s Far-Right LDPR Nominates Leader for 2024 Presidential Race
description: Leonid Slutsky told reporters that he "won't take away votes" from Vladimir Putin, who he expects to "win by a huge margin" in next year's election.

title: Russia Issues Arrest Warrant for Exiled Newspaper Editor
description: Pskovskaya Guberniya chief editor Denis Kamalyagin told MT that "he had been ready" for the arrest warrant, saying it was "only a matter of time."

title: French Sports Retailer Decathlon Secretly Supplying Russia – Disclose
description: The report said Decathlon had put in place "a vast system to conceal its exports as part of a supply agreement" with Russian sports retailer Desport.

title: Russian Publisher Raided for Selling Books By Renowned Writer on 'Extremists and Terrorists' List
description: Prominent Russian-Georgian writer Boris Akunin was added to the country’s “extremists and terrorists” registry this week.

title: Ukrainian Drone Downed Outside Moscow
description: Mayor Sergei Sobyanin said that a drone attack had been “repelled” in the Odintsovo district southwest of the Russian capital.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Kremlin Says Russia Will Circumvent EU Diamond Import Ban
description: Moscow is accused of helping to fill its war chest with proceeds from diamond sales, which are worth an estimated $4 billion to $5 billion a year.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Hyundai Sells St. Petersburg Auto Plant
description: The South Korean automaker reportedly agreed to sell its Russia-based operations to local buyers for a token 7,000 rubles.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Ex-Wagner Fighter Seeks to Testify on Russian ‘War Crimes’ at The Hague
description: Igor Salikov, who flew to the Netherlands on Monday, said he was ready to “plead guilty” to having participated in Russia's war on Ukraine.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia

title: Ukraine Says Fight in Eastern Kharkiv Region ‘Complicated'
description: Russian troops initially captured large swathes of the Kharkiv region, but Kyiv's forces pushed them back in a lightning offensive last year.
artist: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
album: The Moscow Times - Independent News From Russia
